page.title: 08 THE DUCKS
page.content: One of the main features of the beautiful{River Wansbeck}is the colony of mallards which dabble in its waters.They are part of our{heritage and responsible citizens remain fiercely protective towards them. They must have been as unperturbed by{stage_coaches}rattling over the bridge as they are by{low flying jets which now skim our valley.They have ridden out fearsome{floods,}and many generous hands help them through a hard winter. Increasing{vandalism}of eggs,and decreasing nesting sites due to housing development drive many nesting ducks high up the quiet reaches of the river to share the haunts of{otter}and {kingfisher.} Their proud return,ducklings in tow, restores their numbers to around five hundred - and our faith in the future.
